remarks: Move the exponential function from inside a finite product to outside a finite sum.  (Contributed by Scott Fenton, 26-Dec-2017.)
statement:
fprodefsum.1 $e |- Z = ( ZZ>= ` M ) $.
fprodefsum.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. Z ) $.
fprodefsum.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. Z ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fprodefsum $p |- ( ph -> prod_ k e. ( M ... N ) ( exp ` A ) = ( exp ` sum_ k e. ( M ... N ) A ) ) $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
